text: [Music]
[Applause]
welcome to the AWS Report i'm Jeff Bar
today I'm speaking with Chris Wheeler
product manager for the Amazon Simple
Email Service also called SCES welcome
Chris thanks Jeeoff i appreciate you
having me here so what's SCES all about
so Amazon Simple Email Service is a
highly scalable and cost-effective
outbound email sending solution with a
real focus on deliverability okay now
when you first started telling me about
SCES you you started using this word
deliverability and I'm like "Oh that's
an interesting word i've never heard
that before." What's what's
deliverability yeah so deliverability is
a really fancy way of saying what's the
likelihood that the messages are going
to go to where they're intended to go
but doesn't that just happen
automatically no it doesn't uh it's very
it's one of these assumptions that a lot
of folks make uh there are a lot of
things that go on behind the scenes to
ensure that through the the pipes and
the the sending servers and the
receiving servers that a message
actually lands in the inbox of a
recipient uh it doesn't go to the junk
folder doesn't get bounced dropped on
the floor um there's a lot of things
that have to happen to make sure that
your message is uh presented to the
recipient okay so if I'm a brand new
person sending email do I just have to
like set a bid or a flag or somewhere
and it's instantly deliverable no no so
uh for Amazon SCS um we do a lot of uh
work behind the scenes to ensure that
our sending infrastructure so this would
include the MTAs which is mail transfer
agent it's a special name for an email
sending server uh communicating over
port 25 to the ISPs they have servers
that listen on that port um that
actually is transmitted correctly um and
then there are a lot of checks and
filters that are used you may have heard
the term blacklist before uh is the IP
that's connecting on a blacklist or not
um what's the reputation of that IP
there's something called IP seasoning
that we take care of behind the scenes
for customers there's a lot of magic
that happens uh that we you know we take
that the pressure off customers so a lot
of this actually sounds kind of time and
experience based in the sense that you
can't no matter how smart you are you
can't just set these things up and it's
going to happen instantly you said
there's things like seasoning which
implies some level of of time there's
reputation so you need to actually keep
doing things so we've already done that
on behalf of all the recipients or all
all of the senders effectively right
that's exactly right so Amazon SCS is
based on the same technology that
Amazon.com uses to send to its customers
and as you can imagine we have a lot of
experience sending a lot of uh outbound
mail and one of the things that we take
care of for customers is something
called IP seasoning um you throw a new
IP up and then you slowly over time
start sending more mail over those IPs
as long as that mail is considered high
quality by the ISPs you can eventually
get up to uh a normal standard sending
rate now can I simply create a new
account and then start sending thousands
of emails per day with SCES no uh you
can't that's a good question um you to
in order to send through SCES we have
two stages we have what we call the
sandbox which is uh we allow you to send
to any email address that you have
verified um and if you want to get out
of the sandbox you submit a form it's
called a production request form it's
available on the site on our product
detail page um and then you know we'll
go through uh review that and you'll be
moved to production in production you
can send to any email address that you
want well I really appreciate you taking
the time to come by today and talk to us
about SCS yeah you bet anytime Jeff
thanks my pleasure this has been the AWS
Report and I'm Jeff Bar
[Applause]
